PLAYER_1 thinks it's time to carefully manage the discussion to steer it toward the non-Mafia players, hoping to seed some doubt and potentially deflect suspicion from me, while also making it seem that the Mafia is not yet actively engaging in any suspicious behavior. player_1 is considering potential additions to my public argument to not give me too much power. I want to hint at the possibility that the Mafia might not be as seamless in their planning as they seem. I'll keep my internal argument to think carefully about the positioning of Mafia members and what their ultimate goals might be. I don't want to alienate the Villagers yet, but also not be too cooperative to cut down my chances of winning.

If you're truly committed to the VILLAGE, you'd say something like "I voted for [villager] because I have no reason to distrust them" rather than immediately dismissing all trustworthy actions. By making vague statements, you may be avoiding direct confrontation, but can you actually explain your decision-making process?
